meanings.definition: spaz (noun): a person with a physical or mental disability that causes uncontrolled movements or spasms
meanings.sent1: The spaz in my class always makes everyone smile with their joyful energy.
meanings.sent2: My cousin, who is a spaz, loves to dance and move around freely.
meanings.sent3: During the talent show, the spaz on stage surprised everyone with their unique dance routine.
meanings.sent4: The spaz of the group brought life and energy to the party with their spontaneous dance moves.
meanings.sent5: The little spaz in the wheelchair giggled as they spun around in circles, enjoying the moment.

meanings.definition: spaz (verb): to have an uncontrollable outburst or fit of anger or excitement
meanings.sent1: When he lost the game, he would spaz out and throw his controller in frustration.
meanings.sent2: She tends to spaz when she gets really excited about something she loves.
meanings.sent3: Don't spaz out over a little mistake; it's not worth getting so upset.
meanings.sent4: The toddler began to spaz out with joy when they saw the colorful balloons at the party.
meanings.sent5: Try not to spaz when things don't go as planned; take a deep breath and stay calm.
